intro: Senecio hebetatus, commonly known as the woolly goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Senecio hebetatus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive and low-maintenance plant for gardeners.
